info.name: Book of the Fallen - Custom Supernatural Gifts and Boons
info.description: Contains Custom Supernatural Gifts and Boons created specifically for the campaign "Book of the Fallen".

description.p:
You can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.
When you transform, all enemies within 30 ft. of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell DC, taking (Prof. Bonus)d8 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Allies within the same range get healed for (Prof. Bonus)d8 instead.
Your transformation lasts for rounds equal to half your Cleric level (rounded down) or until you end it as a Free Action. During it, you can use your Bonus Action to summon a radiant orb within 60 ft of you. A creature that either passes through or starts its turn in the same square as the orb will regain a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier if it is an ally, or take an equal amount of damage if it is an enemy. The orb then gets consumed. You may have multiple orbs on the field, but they expire when your transformation ends.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Most creatures connected to the Kurald Galain and Elder Darkness realm will have a more positive disposition towards you. You gain a +2 to any Persuasion checks when conversing with one of these creatures.
Notable races are all Tiste Andii, certain groups of Tiste Edur, certain groups of Tiste Liosan, Dark Elves and Vampires.

You can see in darkness as well as any Tiste Andii and your passive perception is increased by 2.
This bonus applies only during night-time or when the character is in Kurald Galain darkness.

A Short Rest can be completed in 10 minutes and a Full Rest only requires 4 hours.
This bonus applies only during night-time or when the character is in Kurald Galain darkness.

You have advantage on death saving throws.
This bonus applies only during night-time or when the character is in Kurald Galain darkness.

When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
This bonus applies only during night-time or when the character is in Kurald Galain darkness.

Ascendants were individuals who had transcended death. In the time of the First Empire they had been called First Heroes. Ascendants could become gods if they gained sufficient following among mortals, but they were not gods by default. Those without worshippers were considered unchained, or Unaligned in the language of the Deck of Dragons.

ul.li: You stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you can’t die from old age.
You are immune to curses, diseases, and the poisoned condition
Increase Charisma and an ability score of your choice by 2 each.

description.p: Shield Anvil is a title given to the leader of the warrior order known as the Iron Company. The Shield Anvil is responsible for leading the order in battle, as well as serving as a spiritual leader and mediator between the people and the Hood, the Lord of Death. The Shield Anvil is also responsible for the protection of the people and the land, and is often called upon to act as a mediator in disputes between the various factions and peoples of the Malazan world. The Shield Anvil is considered to be one of the most powerful and respected figures in the Malazan world. The Shield Anvil, Imogen, is devoted to Hood, the god of death in the Malazan universe, it could mean that she has dedicated her life to serving and honoring the god of death. This could manifest in her actions and beliefs, such as accepting death as a natural part of life and possibly even embracing it. She may also have a strong sense of duty to the dead, and could work to ensure that they receive proper burials and funerary rights. As a member of the Iron Company, a group of mercenaries, her devotion to Hood could also influence her role within the group. She may be a leader of a group of soldiers, who follow her in the belief that death is nothing to be feared, and that it may be a good thing. The Iron Company may be known for their fearless fighting style, as they are not afraid of death.
Shield Anvil is granted the Soul Inspiration Feat.
